title: Internal Compiler Error when compiling the `ring` crate after updating to the 11-27 nightly

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: regression-from-stable-to-nightly
labels.description: Performance or correctness regression from stable to nightly.

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
### Code ```Rust // I am not sure whether this is related to my code or not, but it seems to be related to the `ring` crate ``` ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.50.0-nightly (6a889570e 2020-11-27) binary: rustc commit-hash: 6a889570e46c03d7b156ec08f3f4cb4d145924a3 commit-date: 2020-11-27 host: x86_64-pc-windows-msvc release: 1.50.0-nightly ``` ### Error output ``` thread 'rustc' panicked at 'assertion failed: `(left == right)` left: `DefId(0:1268 ~ ring[904c]::digest::sha2::)`, right: `DefId(0:1269 ~ ring[904c]::digest::sha2::::GFp_sha256_block_data_order)`', compiler\rustc_middle\src\hir\map\collector.rs:227:13 ```
Backtrace

``` stack backtrace: 0: 0x7ff83f67b05e - ::fmt::h106ca6f8fb6a294d 1: 0x7ff83f6a69db - core::fmt::write::h6390b994d95aebdb 2: 0x7ff83f66c798 - ::fmt::hd713332ae62141f3 3: 0x7ff83f67f48d - std::panicking::take_hook::h78f8a454f3a4df82 4: 0x7ff83f67ee84 -
